description: '''Canción melódica''' ({{IPA|es|kanˈθjom meˈloðika|pron}}; Spanish for "melodic song"), also known as '''canción ligera''' ("light song") is a genre of Spanish-language [[popular music]] typically defined by [[sentimental ballad]]s with light, orchestral [[Music|arrangements]]. It grew out of traditional forms [[Latin music (genre)|Latin music]] such as [[bolero]], [[cuplé]] and [[Copla (music)|copla]], and later incorporated strong influences of French [[chanson]] and the Italian pop popularized in the [[Sanremo Music Festival]].
